data.title: The Spectrum
data.text:
'Penguins' is best film in 'Madagascar' franchise

Let's be honest: Dreamworks has produced far better films than "Madagascar" and its sequels. However, the one redeeming factor in those movies are the penguins: Skipper, Kowalski, Rico and Private.

Although it didn't do well at the box office (and I blame the term "Madagascar" being attached), "The Penguins of Madagascar" is flippers down the best movie in the franchise.

THE FILM

Tired of listening to the song "I Like to Move It" (aren't we all?), the penguins bail on the rest of the "Madagascar" crew and set out on their own. But while breaking into one of the most secure locations in America, the gang is birdnapped by a vindictive villain from the penguins' past. Now it's up to the fearless foursome to save all the penguins in zoos around the world from certain destruction.

What sets "Penguins" apart from the other movies is there really is no straight man (or penguin) to speak of. All four of the lead characters are just that — characters — so we're never bogged down by some heavy plotline that seems out of place in a movie where animals talk, do karate and fly jets. The sheer ridiculousness of this movie is what makes it worth seeing more than once.

You'll also need to pop the Blu-ray in a few times to catch all of the celebrity name gags dropped by John Malkovich's character, Dave (like "Nicolas! Cage them!").

With a great voice cast including Benedict Cumberbatch, Ken Jeong, Peter Stormare, Andy Richter and Werner Herzog, there's plenty of talent to go around.

In the end, Dreamworks finally gave us what we wanted: a movie starring just the penguins.

David Paystrup, my fellow copy editor and writer of The Spectrum's Education Itself blog, made a good point: "People only buy the 'Madagascar' Blu-rays for the penguins shorts anyway."

THE EXTRAS

For as fun and funny and rewatchable as the movie is, the extras really fall short. The majority of the so-called bonus features are just a collection of clips from the movie, sadly.

Top Secret Guide to Becoming an Elite Agent

It's clips from the movie with a voiceover on, you guessed it, how to become an elite agent.

'He Is Dave' music video

The theme song for the character of Dave is comprised of — you'll never guess — clips from the movie.

Flipper Slap Shake Waddle and Roll

More clips from the movie. Although I did laugh at this one for its use of the sing-along technique where there is no song.

'Celebrate' Music Video by Pitbull

One of only three special features that aren't comprised of clips, this music video still left much to be desired.

Do The Penguin Shake With Twitch

Twitch, from "So You Think You Can Dance," has choreographed a dance called The Penguin Shake. He teaches you the moves and then urges you to post your dance to social media using the hashtag #PenguinShake. Apparently Dreamworks is going to put together "the world's longest music video."

Deleted Scene

I am incredibly sad this scene, presented in its storyboard form, didn't make it into the final cut of the movie. It would have been hilarious.

Madagascar Mash Up

This is a collection of clips from all the "Madagascar" movies. But don't worry, they're all of our penguin heroes. The interesting part of this bonus content is seeing how much the animation has evolved from the first film.

Global Flight Plan

You guessed it. Clips.

Cheezy Dibbles Ad

More clips.

Gallery

Didn't get enough clips? How about stills from the movie?

The World of Dreamworks Animation

So you've seen clip after clip after clip of "The Penguins of Madagascar." Why not watch clips from other Dreamworks movies? This will give you the option to watch scenes from a variety of other movies like "Shrek," "How To Train Your Dragon 2" and "The Croods."

IS IT WORTH OWNING?

The bonus features on "The Penguins" Blu-ray are really sub par. But the movie itself is great, and it's totally worth your money.
